Body:
Is it possible to read messages from Debug.Write method without Visual Studio? Does anyone know of such a tool?

In NETMF is the possibility in .Net Micro Framework Deployment Tool.

Unfortunatelly Iot Dashboard does not have such a tool.

"
Whoops, I just suggested some desktop debuggers, but those won't work on Win IoT, sorry about that.
It turns out [there is a way to debug your Win IoT app](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/iot/docs/windbg) by using WinDbg, hopefully that will do ya fine.

Thank You. So it is possible but I'm using Raspberry Pi. Reading debug messages via serial connection in IoT device... rate how it sounds :) Additionally WinDbg is part of a large package of tools.		A solution that suggests Rita looks better but I was hope that exist something simpler.
If you can connect with your device over network, you can use ETW viewer in Device Portal. Configuring the logging channel and using LoggingChannel.LogMessage()
column9:
you can printf-debugging for your code.

"
